alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 7:57AM MDT until April 18 at 1:42PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Elm River at Westport affecting Brown County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elm River at Westport. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, The bridge northwest of Kruse Dam will be overtopped * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Monday was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 245 PM CDT.
